intro: Mairia ecklonis, commonly known as the velvetleaf mairia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its leaves are elliptical to ovate in shape, with a smooth texture and a slightly waxy appearance. Mairia ecklonis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
